column5: Came across this today and it would make a great addition to your sled or quad to keep you safe during your ice fishing trips.  http://nebulusflotation.com/  http://fishing.scout.com/story/1507268-if-you-go-through-the-ice?s=197&utm_source=SocialMedia&utm_medium=HootSuitePost&utm_campaign=HootSuite
Very interesting, would make me feel alot safer going over cracks on Simcoe I can tell you that!!!

Yea I just saw this on Facebook as well! certainly something I am going include in my budget when I get a quad or sled! It is expensive, but I don't think you can really put a price on safety... metaphorically speaking lol.  Thanks for sharing though eh
I wonder if a couple of the Auto Inflate life jackets, one on each side would do it? The best thing about them is they would be automatic if submerged.
I was checking that out on the weekend it is a great idea in their video  the atv is totally underwater  but not far down and the thing acts as a raft for people to get on
Yep, a lot easier to recover than from 200' down.

I don't sled but it looks like a great idea and would have one on a sled or ATV, can they be used on a ATV?  . My only question would be that would the air bag be able to push through big slabs of ice to come to the surface. I see where machines have gone down and a huge hole isn't created sometimes and the slabs of ice basically cover where it want down.
